name: Rhododendron
description: Rhododendron is a genus of about 1000 species of shrubs and small trees in the Ericaceae family, native to Asia, Europe, North America and Northern Australia.Rhododendrons come in various shapes, sizes and bloom times. They are wonderful garden plants grown for their bell-shaped flowers and attractive evergreen foliage. The flowers are colorful, showy and sometimes fragrant.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Ancient Greek words “rhodon”, which means “rose” and “dendron” meaning “tree”, and it literally translates to “Rose Tree”.Despite their name, most Rhododendrons grow as shrubs.
color_description: Rhododendron blooms in various colors, from pure white to red, orange and pink to gold and purple.
